sen.j: 二条 良豊（にじょう よしとよ、天文 (元号)5年（1536年） － 天文20年9月2日_(旧暦)（1551年10月1日））は、戦国時代_(日本)の公卿。
sen.e: Yoshitoyo NIJO (1536 - October 1, 1551) was a court noble who lived in the Sengoku period (Japanese Warring States period).

sen.j: 関白左大臣二条尹房の次男。
sen.e: He was a second son of Kanpaku sadaijin (imperial regent and minister of the left) Tadafusa NIJO.
He was a second son of Kanpaku sadaijin (imperial regent and minister of the left) Tadafusa NIJO.

sen.j: 兄弟に関白二条晴良・尋憲らがいた。
sen.e: Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) Haruyoshi NIJO and Junkei are Tadafusa's brothers.

sen.j: 天文18年（1549年）に14歳で元服し、正五位下左近衛少将に叙せられる。
sen.e: Tadafusa celebrated his coming of age at 14 in 1549 and conferred Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 翌年には従三位左近衛中将に昇進する。
sen.e: In the next year, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 天文20年（1551年）正三位非参議であった良豊は父とともに周防国の戦国大名大内義隆の本拠である山口に滞在中に陶晴賢の謀叛に巻き込まれた。
sen.e: In 1551, with his father, Yoshitoyo who was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Hisangi (advisor at large) stayed in Yamaguchi which was the home ground of Yoshitaka OUCHI, Daimyo in the Sengoku period in the Suo Province, and got involved in the rebellion of Harukata SUE.

sen.j: 山口市の法泉寺、次いで長門国（現在山口県長門市）の大寧寺に逃れた。
sen.e: Yoshitoyo and his father fled to take refuge in the Hosen-ji Temple in Yamaguchi at first, then the Tainei-ji Temple (or Dainei-ji Temple) in the Nagato Province (now, Nagato City in the Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: 父を陶軍に殺害され、良豊も大内義隆自害後に陶軍に捕われて自害して果てた（大寧寺の変）。
sen.e: His father was killed by the Sue Camp, Yoshitaka OUCHI was killed himself, and then Yoshitoyo was caught by the Sue Camp and killed himself (Daineiji no hen; the revolt of Daineiji).
